ygData.subject: Re: Frigid Callings
ygData.msgSnippet: Nightshift braces for impact as he narrows his optics.  Why didn t that auto defense system recognize us as Maximals?  It should ve  left our shuttle alone.

Nightshift braces for impact as he narrows his optics.

" Why didn't that a=
uto defense system recognize us as Maximals?  It should've  left our shuttl=
e alone." Unless it's been tampered with.  But how?"

Don't be envious of w=
hat you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is =
worth more than family and friends.

On Nov 11, 2011, at 12:38 PM, Super Cy=
clonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift quick=
ly tries to man a computer to try and get specs on the
> > tower.
> >
> > "=
 Slag, we gotta find a weak spot, pronto, and go with it! That tower has
> =
> gotta go!" Scan'n for vulnerabilities now!"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "Slag man! Th=
at tower *is* Cryonosis," WOLFGANG said as he and RAMULUS
> also manned def=
ensive stations.
> 
> True enough as NIGHTSHIFT called up information the c=
omputer
> identified the tower is CRYONOSIS the tower that hosed the MAXIMA=
L
> WATCHERS. A quick analysis of the attack patturned showed that it was
>=
 an automated defense patturn.
> 
> "I am bringing us around to the back si=
de of the mountains." POLAR
> CLAW said from the front cabin. "Brace yourse=
lves, this is not going
> to be easy, but it should get us out of the line =
of fire."
> 
> The shipped bucked again as another shot hit "We're coming i=
n" PROWL
> said from his position next to POLAR CLAW. "The shields are buck=
ling."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>
